revised_title: Toxic and Chemical Analysis of Poisonous Plants in Western Australia
tldr: The authors conducted a comprehensive study on the poisonous plants of Western Australia, focusing on their chemical properties and toxic effects. They discovered a new alkaloid called "Cygnine" and analyzed other toxic substances such as Cygnose, Gastrolobic Acid, and Gastrolobin. Their findings contribute to understanding the toxic properties of these plants and help in mitigating the losses caused by them in the region.
